subject: RE: [junit] assertSame failure
msgSnippet: Use assertEquals(), as assertSame() does a == comparison not a .equals() comparison. ... From: aimee.ukasick@centare.com [mailto:aimee.ukasick@centare.com]
messageBody:
Use assertEquals(), as assertSame() does a "==" comparison not a
".equals()" comparison.

-----Original Message-----
From: aimee.ukasick@... [mailto:aimee.ukasick@...]
Sent: 29 August 2001 16:33
To: junit@yahoogroups.com
Subject: [junit] assertSame failure


Hi!
In my tests, I'm modifying a value in a HashMap and then making sure
the value has indeed been modified. If I use "assertSame" the test
fails, but if I use "assert" it passes. Is this a JUnit (v3.7) bug?
Has anyone else encountered this?

Fails:
assertSame("custName" ,custName,(String)modifiedMap.get
(CONTACT_NAME));

Passes:
assert("custName", custName.equalsIgnoreCase( (String)modifiedMap.get
(CUST_NAME)) );
assert("custName", custName.equals( (String)modifiedMap.get
(CUST_NAME)) );


Aimee Ukasick
GE Medical Systems
